message: You pick the topic. It should be a) simple enough for new Rubyists to understand, and b) able to be explained in 5-minutes. It's ok if the topic has already been covered at another past meetup since this is meant to be a "recap".
Hey Mark, you still looking for someone?
@benzittlau I can suggest a topic or go ahead and pick one that would be interesting to you.
@benzittlau I am! I want to focus on finishing off the website update and putting together notes on upgrading to Rails 3.1 so I could really use some help. Are you interested?
I was thinking of doing one on bundler and rvm.  Let me know if that makes sense, or throw me another topic and I'll do that up.
I'll play around and see what makes sense.
I'm going to try to do them both together as I think it makes sense to present them as such.  If I can't fit them both in I'll probably focus on rvm.
I think they're important enough that it would be useful for people to see how to use them togethre.

@benzittlau that sounds like a great recap. would you want to do them together in one talk or two seperate ones? if you're able to do it as slides or a screencast that would be great so that we can make it available on the wiki afterwords for new members to follow at their convenience.
If you want longer that's fine. It's just fletcher and I doing long form talk so we've got the time if you want it.

Are you going to show using an .rvmrc or manually switch with rvm use? I guess that might be something for a part II talk if you wanted to keep things simple first time out. Just getting RVM and bundler working is probably enough for most new rubyists.
Cool. I'll leave it to you. Thanks again! Let me know if there's anything you need from me.
